objectives: Students will discuss daily routines and habits using Neutral/Standard register language
Students will engage with Horror themed scenarios related to daily routines and habits
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of neutral level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining daily routines and habits content with Horror narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore daily routines and habits through a Horror lens using Neutral/Standard language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a frightening or supernatural situation involving daily routines and habits

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice neutral register vocabulary related to daily routines and habits in a horror context
Students engage in horror themed role-play about daily routines and habits using neutral register
Students create original horror themed content about daily routines and habits in neutral register

discussion_questions: How would you describe daily routines and habits in a Horror scenario?
What terror or darkness might be involved in daily routines and habits?
Can you create a Horror story about daily routines and habits?
How does daily routines and habits change when viewed through a Horror perspective?
What neutral register expressions would you use to discuss this horror scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Horror situation involving daily routines and habits
roles: Character A: Using neutral register in horror context
Character B: Responding in neutral register within horror theme

topic_genre_blend: daily routines and habits with terror
daily routines and habits with darkness
daily routines and habits with mysterious

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Neutral/Standard throughout: Standard professional communication
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Horror theme: Fear, suspense, supernatural elements

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Neutral/Standard register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Horror themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of neutral register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
